intro: Stelis coripatae, commonly known as the Peruvian orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture in its high-altitude habitat. Stelis coripatae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated for its delicate floral display.
